description: Import single or multi-volume disk images or EBS snapshots into an Amazon Machine Image (AMI). For more information, see Importing a VM as an image using VM Import/Export in the VM Import/Export User Guide.

parameters.name: Architecture
parameters.description: The architecture of the virtual machine. Valid values: i386 | x86_64

parameters.name: ClientData
parameters.description: The client-specific data. Comment (string) --- A user-defined comment about the disk upload. UploadEnd (datetime) --- The time that the disk upload ends. UploadSize (float) --- The size of the uploaded disk image, in GiB. UploadStart (datetime) --- The time that the disk upload starts.

nested_params.name: Comment
nested_params.description: A user-defined comment about the disk upload.

nested_params.name: UploadEnd
nested_params.description: The time that the disk upload ends.

nested_params.name: UploadSize
nested_params.description: The size of the uploaded disk image, in GiB.

nested_params.name: UploadStart
nested_params.description: The time that the disk upload starts.

parameters.name: DiskContainers
parameters.description: Information about the disk containers. (dict) --- Describes the disk container object for an import image task. Description (string) --- The description of the disk image. DeviceName (string) --- The block device mapping for the disk. Format (string) --- The format of the disk image being imported. Valid values: OVA | VHD | VHDX | VMDK | RAW SnapshotId (string) --- The ID of the EBS snapshot to be used for importing the snapshot. Url (string) --- The URL to the Amazon S3-based disk image being imported. The URL can either be a https URL (https://..) or an Amazon S3 URL (s3://..) UserBucket (dict) --- The S3 bucket for the disk image. S3Bucket (string) --- The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the disk image is located. S3Key (string) --- The file name of the disk image.

nested_params.name: Description
nested_params.description: The description of the disk image.

nested_params.name: DeviceName
nested_params.description: The block device mapping for the disk.

nested_params.name: Format
nested_params.description: The format of the disk image being imported. Valid values: OVA | VHD | VHDX | VMDK | RAW.

nested_params.name: SnapshotId
nested_params.description: The ID of the EBS snapshot to be used for importing the snapshot.

nested_params.name: Url
nested_params.description: The URL to the Amazon S3-based disk image being imported. The URL can either be a https URL (https://..) or an Amazon S3 URL (s3://..)

nested_params.name: UserBucket
nested_params.description: The S3 bucket for the disk image.

nested_params.name: S3Bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the disk image is located.

nested_params.name: S3Key
nested_params.description: The file name of the disk image.

parameters.name: Hypervisor
parameters.description: The target hypervisor platform. Valid values: xen.

parameters.name: KmsKeyId
parameters.description: An identifier for the symmetric KMS key to use when creating the encrypted AMI. This parameter is only required if you want to use a non-default KMS key; if this parameter is not specified, the default KMS key for EBS is used. If a KmsKeyId is specified, the Encrypted flag must also be set. The KMS key identifier may be provided in any of the following formats: Key ID Key alias ARN using key ID. The ID ARN contains the arn:aws:kms namespace, followed by the Region of the key, the Amazon Web Services account ID of the key owner, the key namespace, and then the key ID. For example, arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:012345678910:key/abcd1234-a123-456a-a12b-a123b4cd56ef. ARN using key alias. The alias ARN contains the arn:aws:kms namespace, followed by the Region of the key, the Amazon Web Services account ID of the key owner, the alias namespace, and then the key alias. For example, arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:012345678910:alias/ExampleAlias. Amazon Web Services parses KmsKeyId asynchronously, meaning that the action you call may appear to complete even though you provided an invalid identifier. This action will eventually report failure. The specified KMS key must exist in the Region that the AMI is being copied to. Amazon EBS does not support asymmetric KMS keys.

parameters.name: LicenseType
parameters.description: The license type to be used for the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) after importing. Specify AWS to replace the source-system license with an Amazon Web Services license or BYOL to retain the source-system license. Leaving this parameter undefined is the same as choosing AWS when importing a Windows Server operating system, and the same as choosing BYOL when importing a Windows client operating system (such as Windows 10) or a Linux operating system. To use BYOL, you must have existing licenses with rights to use these licenses in a third party cloud, such as Amazon Web Services. For more information, see Prerequisites in the VM Import/Export User Guide.

parameters.name: Platform
parameters.description: The operating system of the virtual machine. If you import a VM that is compatible with Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) using an EBS snapshot, you must specify a value for the platform. Valid values: Windows | Linux.

parameters.name: LicenseSpecifications
parameters.description: The ARNs of the license configurations. (dict) --- The request information of license configurations. LicenseConfigurationArn (string) --- The ARN of a license configuration.

nested_params.name: LicenseConfigurationArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of a license configuration.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to apply to the import image task during creation. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: BootMode
parameters.description: The boot mode of the virtual machine.

nested_items.name: Architecture
nested_items.description: The architecture of the virtual machine.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the import task.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the AMI is encrypted.

nested_items.name: Hypervisor
nested_items.description: The target hypervisor of the import task.

nested_items.name: ImageId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) created by the import task.

nested_items.name: ImportTaskId
nested_items.description: The task ID of the import image task.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the symmetric KMS key that was used to create the encrypted AMI.

nested_items.name: LicenseType
nested_items.description: The license type of the virtual machine.

nested_items.name: Platform
nested_items.description: The operating system of the virtual machine.

nested_items.name: Progress
nested_items.description: The progress of the task.

nested_items.name: SnapshotDetails
nested_items.description: Information about the snapshots.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the snapshot.

nested_items.name: DeviceName
nested_items.description: The block device mapping for the snapshot.

nested_items.name: DiskImageSize
nested_items.description: The size of the disk in the snapshot, in GiB.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: The format of the disk image from which the snapshot is created.

nested_items.name: Progress
nested_items.description: The percentage of progress for the task.

nested_items.name: SnapshotId
nested_items.description: The snapshot ID of the disk being imported.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: A brief status of the snapshot creation.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A detailed status message for the snapshot creation.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL used to access the disk image.

nested_items.name: UserBucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket for the disk image.

nested_items.name: S3Bucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket from which the disk image was created.

nested_items.name: S3Key
nested_items.description: The file name of the disk image.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: A brief status of the task.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A detailed status message of the import task.

nested_items.name: LicenseSpecifications
nested_items.description: The ARNs of the license configurations.

nested_items.name: LicenseConfigurationArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of a license configuration.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags assigned to the import image task.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: UsageOperation
nested_items.description: The usage operation value.
